snippet: A finding by the Federal Trade Commission that Google had not broken the law by highlighting its own services in search results could strengthen the firm’s already dominant position.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission hands Google major victory by declaring company has not violated antitrust or anticompetition statutes in way it arranges its Web search results; FTC decision, after nearly two-year investigation, allows Google to continue to present search results that highlight its own services, which could enable company to further strengthen its already dominant position on the Internet.
lead_paragraph: A finding by the Federal Trade Commission that Google had not broken the law by highlighting its own services in search results could strengthen the firm’s already dominant position.

headline.main: A Victory for Google as F.T.C. Takes No Formal Steps
headline.print_headline: U.S. Ends Inquiry On Web Search; Google Is Victor
